name: Beginning of the Fourth Age
description: The Fourth Age begins, in the year 3021 of the Third Age. The last year of the Third Age is thus also the first year of the Fourth Age. March 25: According to the Reckoning of Gondor the Fourth Age begins on this day. Birth of Elanor, Sam's daughter. September 21: Frodo and Sam depart from Hobbiton towards the Grey Havens. September 22: At Woody End they meet Elrond, Galadriel and Bilbo. September 29: They reach the Grey Havens, where Gandalf awaits them and a ship lies ready. At the last moment Merry and Pippin arrive to bid farewell. Bilbo and Frodo go aboard with Gandalf, Galadriel and Elrond and sail westward. The Third Age ends here officially. October 6: Sam, Merry and Pippin return to the Shire.

name: Birth of Frodo Gamgee
description: In this year Frodo Gamgee, Sam's eldest son, is born.

name: Birth of Rose Gamgee
description: Rose, Sam's second daughter is born.

name: Political changes in the Shire
description: Will Whitfoot retires. Samwise is elected Mayor of the Shire. Peregrin Took marries Diamond of Long Cleeve. Death of Hamfast Gamgee. King Elessar issues a decree that Men may not enter the Shire, and he makes it a Free Land under the protection of the Northern Sceptre.

name: Birth of Faramir Took
description: Birth of Faramir Took, Pippin's son.

name: Birth of Goldilocks Gamgee
description: Birth of Goldilocks Gamgee, Sam's daughter.

name: Merry becomes Master of Buckland
description: Merry becomes Master of Buckland. Great gifts are sent to him by Éomer and Éowyn from Ithilien.

name: Pippin becomes Thain
description: Death of Paladin Took. Pippin becomes Thain of the Shire. King Elessar appoints him together with Merry and Sam as Counsellors of the Northern Kingdom. In the same year Sam is re-elected Mayor.

name: Death of Glóin and royal visit
description: Death of Glóin, Gimli's father. Aragorn rides north and remains for some time at Lake Evendim. At the Brandywine Bridge he meets his friends and presents Sam with the Star of the Dúnedain. Elanor becomes Maid of Honour to Queen Arwen.

name: Sam's third mayoral term
description: Sam is elected Mayor for the third time in succession.

name: Sam's journey to Gondor
description: Sam rides south together with his wife and daughter. They spend a year in Gondor. Tolman Cotton takes over the office of Mayor as deputy this year.

name: Sam's fourth mayoral term
description: Sam is elected Mayor for the fourth time.

name: Wedding of Elanor and birth of Eldarion
description: On the Far Downs the wedding of Elanor and Fastred of Greenholm takes place. Eldarion, son of Elessar and Arwen is born about this time.

name: Westmarch incorporation
description: The Westmarch becomes an official part of the Shire. Many Hobbits migrate there.

name: Birth of Elfstan Fairbairn
description: Birth of Sam Gamgee's grandson Elfstan Fairbairn.

name: Administrative changes and death of Imrahil
description: Death of Imrahil of Dol Amroth. Sam becomes Mayor for the fifth time and at his request Fastred is appointed by the Thain as Warden of Westmarch. Elanor and Fastred move to Undertowers on the Tower Hills.

name: Marriage of Faramir Took and Goldilocks
description: Faramir Took marries Goldilocks Gamgee, Sam's daughter.

name: Sam's final mayoral term
description: Sam becomes Mayor for the seventh and last time.

name: Death of Elphir
description: Elphir, eldest son of Imrahil and 23rd Prince of Dol Amroth dies.

name: Sam passes into the West
description: On Mid-year's Day Rosie, wife of Samwise Gamgee, dies. On September 22 Master Samwise departs from Bag End and rides to the Tower Hills, where he gives Elanor the Red Book, which from then on remains in the possession of the Fairbairns. According to the family tradition handed down by Elanor, Samwise then rode to the Grey Havens and sailed from there as the last of the Ring-bearers over the Sea.

name: Death of King Éomer and departure of Merry and Pippin
description: King Éomer of Rohan dies, his son Elfwine becomes his successor. "In the spring of this year a message came from Rohan to Buckland that King Éomer wished to see Master Holdwine once more. Meriadoc was then old (102) but still hale. He took counsel with his friend, the Thain, and soon after they handed over their goods and offices to their sons and rode away over the Sarn Ford, and they were not seen again in the Shire. It was heard after that Master Meriadoc came to Edoras and was with the King before he died in that autumn. Then he and Thain Peregrin went to Gondor and passed what short years were left to them in that realm, until they died and were laid to rest in Rath Dínen among the great of Gondor" (The Lord of the Rings, Sixth Book, Appendix B, The Tale of Years).

name: Death of Faramir
description: Death of Faramir, his son Elboron becomes Steward and Prince of Ithilien.

name: Death of Dwalin
description: Death of Dwalin in the extraordinary age of 340.

name: Death of Alphros
description: Alphros, son of Elphir and 24th Prince of Dol Amroth dies.

name: Death of King Elessar and end of the Fellowship
description: King Elessar dies. His son Eldarion ascends the throne. "In this year on March 1 came at last the passing of King Elessar. It is said that the beds of Meriadoc and Peregrin were set beside the bed of the great king. Then Legolas built a grey ship in Ithilien, and sailed down Anduin and so over Sea; and with him, it is said, went Gimli the Dwarf. And when that ship passed an end was come in Middle-earth of the Fellowship of the Ring." (The Lord of the Rings, Sixth Book, Appendix B, The Tale of Years)

name: Death of Arwen
description: Death of Arwen in Lothlórien.

name: Completion of the Red Book copy
description: The copy of the Red Book is completed in Gondor by Findegil, the King's Writer.

name: Death of King Eldarion
description: About this time Eldarion, second King of the Reunited Kingdom, dies.
